website_summaries.verdict: The Ouya could be a great, inexpensive Android-based gaming system for everyone. Right now, though, it isn't even close.
pros: Future software updates might fix most problems

customer_reviews.title: Ouya.... For Emulation is great.
customer_reviews.text: Decided to get one of these as I love playing Retro games on emulators. Not really interested in the actual Ouya games. Got it today and after the initial 20 minute firmware update, I started playing with it. I installed 'RetroArch' and plugged in my USB HDD with 1000's or roms/isos on it. After fiddling around a while, I managed to get most games working in full screen with sound etc. The only games I'm having trouble with is Gamecube, Nintendo 64 and Dreamcast. With a little more fiddling, I'm sure I will get them all working. So far, so good. And at £58 it was well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Strebor_

customer_reviews.title: Great for XBMC
customer_reviews.text: Like some other reviewers, I bought this for an XBMC, so I can't really comment on the gaming aspect. It plays movies fine, though it does struggle occasionally with large 1080p files (it gets pretty hot in here, that might be part of the problem). Build quality of the controller is somewhat sub-par: the 'down' button occasionally triggers the 'left' button, which makes navigating a hassle... Overall, I'm happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deranged Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: not as bad as some say
customer_reviews.text: Have had a short play around with one and yeah can see that alot of games are not my cup of tea , however there are a few that seem good fun .I think a lot of people were happy to slam these before giving them the real chance they deserve ..for a £100 they really are not that bad ..they are not about hardcore gaming, mega graphics and power just good fun . Looking forward to trying the emulators . My only grumble is wi-fi does not seem that good I didn't seem to be able to receive a strong signal like I should have ,I had to use a cable .
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Decent idea, not so good execution
customer_reviews.text: It's basically cheap mobile phone games that don't work on a bit of chancer tech. I don't believe it will take off as it does nothing your phone/tablet/web browser won't do. Add on top of this that sometimes it freezes up, won't launch a game or otherwise just seems to struggle with the task it was designed for made me ebay it off. It's sad really, I can see what the designers were going for - almost the raspberry pi equivalent of a gaming console, but I personally don't think it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my son
customer_reviews.text: Bought this mainly for XBMC rather than games. He wanted it as it seemed his forum set for XBMC thought it was a good platform. His opinion is that it is ok but average performance and does not rate many of the free games. However as a compromise for XBMC and games it is acceptable but not as good as other XBMC boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Alan N. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great product, I've actually been using it just as much as a browser but the quality of the product is great and better than i actually expected, The selection of games are great and range from small indie titles to bigger name titles but either way there is some great fun to be had if you are open minded to trying different types of games, Great also as a multimedia box. Highly recommended. Great delivery times by amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Mal

customer_reviews.title: Nice little console for its price
customer_reviews.text: Well for its price there is not much more to say then very good value really. but apart from that it has some very nice features first of all it has a nice section for games that you can just click install and run but I like how it is very easy to side load applications for example onlive's free app can be side loaded so you can play steamed games using your ouya and have quite demanding games steamed though to your ouya (this depends on how good your internet connection is and I would recommend using a wired connection)
customer_reviews.author: reece a clarke

customer_reviews.title: Small & Compact HTPC Replacement
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased to replace a htpc for the primary use of running xbmc software. This was by far a great investment. Now currently using as a home theater pc replacement and running various of emulation software to play classic video game roms. The OUYA stock rom isn't the best and highly recommend installing a custom launcher rom to get the best functionality from the device. You may also consider replacing the default fan inside the OUYA case for something abit more silent if planning on heavy usage. Runs xbmc gothem like a dream, all xbmc skins run smoothly and offers various amounts of customisation. Highly recommended device to replace xbmc based htpcs.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great little device with so much potential , runs xbmc perfect far better then over rated Apple TV , emulators run great as well, for people complaining about portable hard drive issues are you looking in the right place, get a file manager and you will find your device under USB drive in the root of the console , tested mine with various drives and works fine , by far the best 100 quid I have spent in a while.
customer_reviews.author: j pearson

customer_reviews.title: Great console just requires some love and care! (UPDATED)
customer_reviews.text: This console is great for emulation, out of the box just connect it to your internet connection and you have lots of emulation apps that run really well. Sometimes some problem emerges but i have always found a solution online. All-in-all great fun, just remenber this is not a PS4 or XbOne. The price is great also! UPDATE: I've been playing SNES, NES, NeoGeo, and PS1 On my ouya and i can tell you guys it works great, the controll support is also top notch, if you have spare bluetooth or usb controllers around use them! I hope people support this because i want to play Dreamcast, GameCube and ps2 (one day!)on a tiny tiny device.
customer_reviews.author: Hugodastrevas

customer_reviews.title: The Possibilites are almost infinite!
customer_reviews.text: I think this is quite possibly one of the best things I've ever bought and am not even exaggerating. Bought this because it runs on android, so it can do anything that android can do (if you know what I mean). If in the right hands the possibilities with this console are almost infinite.
customer_reviews.author: Rashedur Rahman

customer_reviews.title: Very good alternative to having XBMC on a pc or mac
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good bit of hardware, wouldn't say it's easy to work with without some direction from install videos on the internet, but well made and reliable and fairly quick. I purchased it predominantly for XBMC, and it's fairly stable. Would definitely recommend the OUYA box.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. K. J. Rebeiro

customer_reviews.title: The console itself is okay, but the tech supports ...
customer_reviews.text: The console itself is okay, but the tech supports are a bunch of idiots who didn't read my question and I ended up with two power supplies I cannot use because they have the incorrect plug.
customer_reviews.author: Jure Sah

customer_reviews.title: Good little unit for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Good little unit for gaming, i originally purchased to run the media center XBMC but found it a little underpowered for this to be honest, best used for casual gaming and even then the controllers style outweighs its function.
customer_reviews.author: james gooding

customer_reviews.title: Solid little console
customer_reviews.text: The OUYA is a good little console. Sure, there are better, more expensive options, but this one is good. The controller doesn't lag and is well-made. The console has a couple of nice games and a lot of crappy ones, but this is less of a drawback, since they are all free-to-try. Software updates happen monthly, which is apt considering it just came out and needs polishing here and there. I'm having a lot of fun playing simple local multiplayer games on it.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Romero

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap entry to gaming
customer_reviews.text: I have tried xbox and ps3, both brilliant game consoles but if want quick fun gaming at a low price this is way to go. I sideloaded dead trigger brilliant on big tv. Games like dub wars were made for this format. Only had few days and all good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Turraloon

customer_reviews.title: Great Little toy
customer_reviews.text: The games are not fantastic but if you like to tinker (They encourage it) it is a very decent media player and has loads of functions. Getting emulations to run is not hard at all and playing old classics like SMB is great fun. I would recommend this any day. (For media try and use Plex, the install is on their app store)
customer_reviews.author: Kasterappel

customer_reviews.title: Professional look and feel
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the overall look and feel. If you compare this to a Minix they do not compete even in the same series. The one of a few professionally designed Android devices. Games and apps are a bit scarce but just being able to run a really capable Xbmc version on it and I'm home. For somewhere around $99, it doesn't get any better. But remember what you are buying, it's not like an iPad with hundred of thousands of games and apps.
customer_reviews.author: Mikael Forselius

customer_reviews.title: Great device ruined by terrible WIFI antenna
customer_reviews.text: The Ethernet port broke and the OUYA's WIFI is absolutely terrible. Worst WIFI I've ever had on a device and if you don't believe me just look at the forums! Otherwise a very competent device, such a pity they cheaped out on the WIFI antenna :(
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Boyes

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of hardware, shame the software offering is not tha tgreat
customer_reviews.text: I love my Ouya, but weirdly I don't use it mainly as a game platform but as a media platform. The games available on Ouya are still not that impressive, but hopefully this will change soon.
customer_reviews.author: bz

customer_reviews.title: My second ouya! Daughter took me 1st one
customer_reviews.text: Great console that should be way more popular than it is! Adverts would help...I still love mine just as much and this one is actually my second one as i was a backer from kick starter and my daughter is using the original one
customer_reviews.author: byron

customer_reviews.title: ouya
customer_reviews.text: Great little console gets a bit hot I have a usb fan under it so it runs smoothly took a bit to root it but I now have Google play and Netflix also xbmc my son has it as a entertainment unit in his bed Room and gets good use of it
customer_reviews.author: Paul Golding

customer_reviews.title: Great for Xbmc
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure about the quality of the games offered from the Marketplace, but if you sideload the Xbmc (Because the one on the Ouya store has problems with licence of the sound codecs) its a great little multimedia box , capable of delivering top notch 720p content without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: A.M

customer_reviews.title: Great XBMC box
customer_reviews.text: Bought for mainly using as xbmc client. Plays all files and navigates all menus perfectly fine (considering it was £100) One thing worth noting is that the fan comes on for most of the time when playing video files and it is audible from the other side of the room but I am hoping to get a replacement fan which will hopefully remedy this
customer_reviews.author: jonathan glynn

customer_reviews.title: Cool but not amazing
customer_reviews.text: Cool but not amazing. I got it for emulation and tbh everything felt a bit "sticky" and hard to control, like there was major input lag.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great combination as game platform and as mediaplayer (with XBMC)
customer_reviews.text: I had been eagerly waiting for the release and couldn't wait for my OUYA to arrive. As soon as it was available I ordered it here. I must say that I am very pleased with the OUYA, only the lack of the Google Play store is a minus for me but looking at XDA Developers forum I see a lot of work done to get this working as well.
customer_reviews.author: JHS_NL

customer_reviews.title: nice bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: control pad does feel a bit strange at times, especially when playing games, I use it for XMBC and Mame and works fine.
customer_reviews.author: kyo182

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Bought a Apple TV early last year didn't really live up to my hopes then found the ouya. Best buy ever xbmc work brilliant on it plus it is very easy to side load apps and roms and emulators
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this box. Saved a fortune not having to go to the cinema. So Small so doesn't take up any space. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lesley

customer_reviews.title: top XBMC player
customer_reviews.text: this is the most stable xbmc streaming device I have used, another bonus is the PSX emulator also very stable
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Simpkin

customer_reviews.title: It does what it sets out to do.
customer_reviews.text: don't compare it with a PS3 or a 360. This is toy that brings mobile and indie games to your big screen, at an amazingly low price. And on top of that, gets you back all your old consoles, through easy emulation. If you start off, get Ittle Dew. That game has great puzzles and humor.
customer_reviews.author: Sven Van de Perre

customer_reviews.title: Its good but no support
customer_reviews.text: As a device is a excellent, although having android as operating system makes it little bit slow and buggy. The only thing that is little bit annoying is the support that does not exist from ouya website, just submitting a request, there is no phone number, so it takes too long.
customer_reviews.author: Antonis Christou

customer_reviews.title: budget console
customer_reviews.text: my Ouya just delivered after 20 days because of stock issue. and after trying it for a couple of free games im amazed by the graphics. its a great budget console and im loving it. better than nintendo ds
customer_reviews.author: catalino

customer_reviews.title: Nice, pretty and cooooool
customer_reviews.text: Simple, cheap, easy, funnnnnny... A great little thing for a lot of fun. Games are cheap, some are really good and you can find a lot of personnal works, far from all those silly things you can find on other consoles...
customer_reviews.author: Parisot

customer_reviews.title: The best unit to run xbmc
customer_reviews.text: Excellent console unit that operates very smooth. Super to run xbmc. Very compact + remote very user friendly. Smart design.
customer_reviews.author: Raj Patel

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Decent games, handy for full HD when using Plex server.
customer_reviews.author: kevinrobinson

customer_reviews.title: a good console
customer_reviews.text: small, easy to install and let me have fun phone games and adroid games where they must bee, in my tv. the only problem i had was the power conector, unfortunate, in Brasil we use anther type, but this is just a detail.
customer_reviews.author: Humberto Meale

customer_reviews.title: Super!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice! Amazing console open for geek lover...:) Nice packaging and perhaps new future of videogame. You can play online games and install android app...

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great machines for losing track of time with. Shame more people didn't do the same.
customer_reviews.author: S Stratford

customer_reviews.title: Ouya Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Ouya meet and surpass my initial expectations. Is my new console and media center. day by Day the Ouya evolve to greater device :)

customer_reviews.title: XBMC!
customer_reviews.text: The games are poor. The only reason I use ouya is for XBMC as that way i don't have to jailbreak my ipad. However, just for XBMC buying OUYA is already worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Juan

customer_reviews.title: Complete product
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying the OUYA so much, it has a lot of posibilities. And its size is perfect to take it anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Cris

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product arrived promptly. Works a treat, easy set up and great quality.No negatives as it is giving great enjoyment...highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Great little console
customer_reviews.text: If you want to play retro games or searching for an Android box to install XBMC then look no further, OUYA is a great choice.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect working, nice group games to play with friends! Also I'll begin to develop as soon as possible on it.

customer_reviews.title: Good combo with xbmc
customer_reviews.text: Great to watch movies after installing xbmc! I do recommend... there is no problem at all! Plays flawlessly even Blu-ray movies.
customer_reviews.author: Igor Gomes

customer_reviews.title: Top
customer_reviews.text: It's PERFECT to play games with friends or some indie games. Some of the games have a really surprising quality!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Diogo Branco

customer_reviews.title: I liked it :)
customer_reviews.text: Not a hardcore gaming console per say if you ask me, but great for those who wants to emulate old games or just wanna play some casual games :)
customer_reviews.author: Maund001

customer_reviews.title: Class
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product runs xbmc smoothly! Get on of these instead of cheaper alternatives!
customer_reviews.author: justin sutton

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money really good. Very nice and small. If u like your old stool consoles then you need this
customer_reviews.author: Carl Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Quite good
customer_reviews.text: Good but to few games. So, ad more games to match upp. The question of pairing controllers every start is anoying.
customer_reviews.author: Bengt Andersson

customer_reviews.title: Great !
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Console ! I recommend it for all part time gamers around the world. With a very reasonable price .
customer_reviews.author: Manuel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little console
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing for children and adults. Play a variety of emulators, android games and OUYA exclusives all on one tiny little console. A rechargeable battery pack with the option to connect a cable would of been nice but i can see why this was not implemented. 1. The console is to small and it seems they wanted to keep the i/o interface to a minimum. 2. I'm guessing it may of had a significant impact on the design costs leading to higher consumer costs. I will be spending some serious time on this little beast!
customer_reviews.author: MrsSmith

customer_reviews.title: Its great, if you know why you are getting it.
customer_reviews.text: My primary reason for getting it to have a cheap android development platform with NVIDIA hardware, and as a test environment for a resource limited console game project. Its not bad for the price, although the controller could use some improvement. There are now Tegra4 based microconsoles with better gamepads, but these cost much more. For this price, its a nice little toy. Mind you, this does not meant to compete with the big consoles.
customer_reviews.author: Ambrosian Spactor

customer_reviews.title: Ouya OhNo
customer_reviews.text: I am returning this product as it is not fit for purpose. Controller has a big lag when using it,and Xbmc keeps crashing, Very noisy when the fan kicks in gets hot as well. Great idea but needs to go back and get the bugs ironed out.
customer_reviews.author: Pot Noodle !!!

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: picked this up as i was really excited for it and the concept of it. unfortunately its never really been touched. overall its not great quality, cheap plastic material. setting it up to run emulators whcih was my main reason for it was just annoying. its far easier to just do it on the pc. as for the actualy marketplace on the console, its overpriced indie games. would love to pick some of the games up but theres no point when you can get majority of them way cheaper through the likes of steam. have always wanted to sell this but just havent ever bothered it just sits gathering dust.
customer_reviews.author: matty

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the naysayers
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of negative reviews before I bought my Ouya, and frankly I have no idea what console they were talking about, because it sure as hell wasn't this one. I've had zero problems with the controller, no lag, and although my original console was defective, Ouya sent me a replacement immediately with no hesitation at all. It's not a PS3, no, but with a bit of discretion the game selection is excellent. If you want a simple, hackable mini-console for messing about with, OUYA is the way to go. Would recommend to anyone. After all, what the hell is £99 these days?
customer_reviews.author: WGA ROBINSON

customer_reviews.title: Great, if you have the heart of a developer
customer_reviews.text: As already said by other buyers, Ouya is extremely cheap and small; setting it up is simple and new games are released all the time, making it full of indie, imaginative games. Besides this, you may love it or be disappointed, depending on your expectations. If you have "the heart of a developer" and you are looking for a "hack friendly" game console, driven by the open source philosophy, Ouya is definitely for you! On the other hand, if you are looking for a "game console" in the traditional sense of the term, then you'd better purchase an XBox or a Playstation. Personally, I love its open philosophy and its "hack friendship".
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Bessi

customer_reviews.title: Little box of awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: this is by far the best games console I have had since the XBOX original its not the best graphics probley on par with the xbox original but don't let that stop you from buying this little box first of all its only £99 all the games like towerfall and clark are some of the most original i have seen for a long time it also links up with ps3 controlers so you can take it around your mates house and spend hours on towerfall My nefue and neace love this box because of towerfall all games are free to try not to mention the emulators and XBMC Buy one now :)
customer_reviews.author: Vibe1979

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: Ouya is great. Great for media center with xbmc. Great for emulation psx and snes. There is quiet good android games and you can install a lot off apps. It have very good web browser. You can connect external wireless keyboard and mouse. and netflix is working here with out any problems. It is very good stuff for bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Radoslaw Tarnopolski

customer_reviews.title: High expectations
customer_reviews.text: The OUYA itself is a good console and Android system, but the controller that was their main focus is very poor. Easily lost connection with the console, just for being more than 2,5 meters away. The battery lids, which cover most of the front of the controller comes off very easily, and while you're playing, it feels like the lids could come off by the slightest movement, which is not very reassuring. The good thing is that if you want an alternative, you can easily connect a Bluetooth controller, like the PS3 dual shock.
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Cunha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price/quality product!
customer_reviews.text: Ouya is interesting concept and for me, it's success! Console itself is really tiny but packs a punch with quad core Tegra 3 outputting 1080p! Controller feels a little cheap but it's great design balances it. Selection of Android games for Ouya are good and there's much more to come so the lack of software isn't a problem here. Also Ouya team is constantly improving it's console through system updates that adds new features and fixes bugs etc. If you are interested of Android games but don't want to play via smartphone/tablets touch screen, then Ouya is for you and it doesn't cost you a lot of money either!
customer_reviews.author: Mano Saarinen

customer_reviews.title: OUYA -The gift that keeps on giving!
customer_reviews.text: How can one small box give so much happiness? From zombie shooting to space invading, with a side order of amazing video and music playback. Did I mention streaming? This is one of those rare purchases that delivers even more than it promises. I love the try before you buy games experience. I'll be buying more as Christmas gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Nottme

customer_reviews.title: nice design. Easy to get started
customer_reviews.text: Compact, nice design. Easy to get started. It supports XBMC (media player program), which is my main reason for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rost Magnus

customer_reviews.title: It's a lovely console
customer_reviews.text: The games that are out there are okay, but the best thing is that it can run various emulators. Play old arcade or NEO GEO titles glitch free on your OUYA - awesome!

customer_reviews.title: Great Box
customer_reviews.text: I had heard of this box, but I thought not functioned very well in portugal, but on the contrary I love seeing all my series in real time and every movie that hasn't even come out in Portugal, was really an excellent buy and super fast delivery.

customer_reviews.title: Great product! Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Works like a charm, just as I expected. So you know, the package comes with North American 2-pins plug.

customer_reviews.text: Great console, arrived in time with everything that was advertised in a good-looking case. Thanks and keep up the good work

customer_reviews.text: fantastic , big console for little money even great for snes games and msx games , the emulators are great

customer_reviews.text: I have order it and try, i think it will be a nice console, waiting the killer application :), great hardware!

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Really cheap and awesome console! Games are really cheap! Help indie developers! You won't regret it! Cool media center! Highly recommend it!

customer_reviews.title: Great console for retro gamer's that don't want to waste a fortune on retro gaming consoles.
customer_reviews.text: It's cheap and got good games and emulators to work with, an console for a old school gamer. You might want to give it a try.
customer_reviews.author: Pontus Tapani Lindedahl

product_meta.title: OUYA Console (Electronic Games)
product_meta.description:
Video games just feel bigger and better on a TV screen. Surround Sound. HD. A room full of friends. Console gaming isn’t going anywhere, but console games aren’t as much fun as they could be.

That’s why the OUYA, a new kind of game console, exists--to bring groundbreaking games to the television in an entirely new way.

Games Only on OUYA

You download OUYA games directly to your console--no discs to buy or scratch.

And the games on OUYA are made by some of the most inventive game developers in the business. Favorite franchises like Final Fantasy, brand new never-before-seen titles and hundreds of other games. Shooters, platformers, role-playing games, action games... You name it.

And, best of all, every game on OUYA is free to try. You might end up investing in that coin doubler, buying the healing elixir that extends your life, or unlocking the full version of the game, but everything -- absolutely everything -- is free to try.

Small... but Powerful

OUYA is about the size of a Rubik’s cube, but it plays hard in full-screen HD. It uses an nVIDIA quad-core CPU and outputs via HDMI at up to a stunning 1080p resolution. It powers on instantly.

Need more storage? No problem. Just plug in an external hard drive into the USB 2.0 port. Like to hardwire your Internet? That’s cool. Jack into OUYA’s high-speed ethernet port. WiFi works too. If you want to develop games, just plug your laptop into our micro-USB port -- anyone can release an OUYA game. And the hardware opens so you can customize it if that’s your bag.

We listen to our supporters, and try to evolve OUYA so it always gets better for them. When you buy OUYA, you become part of our effort to change how console gaming works.

Additional Requirements

You will need a valid credit or debit card to download OUYA content. Your card will not be charged unless you choose to make a purchase. Though many games on OUYA will not require a purchase to unlock additional content or features, others may offer for purchase in-game products or additional features (like full versions or additional levels).



BOX CONTAINS


OUYA game console
OUYA wireless controller with removable faceplates
HDMI cable
Two AA batteries
Power adapter
feature_bullets: Download games directly to OUYA -- no discs to buy or scratch
Games made by some of the most inventive game developers in the business. Favorite franchises like Final Fantasy, brand new never-before-seen titles and hundreds of other games
Shooters, platformers, role-playing games, action games... You name it
Every game on OUYA is free to try. We believe you shouldn't have to buy it unless you love it
OUYA is about the size of a Rubik's cube, but it plays hard in full-screen HD
Powered by nVIDIA quad-core CPU, outputs via HDMI at up to a stunning 1080p resolution
